intro: Hieracium revocantiforme, commonly known as the silverleaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer, and its stems are often hairy and slightly reddish. Hieracium revocantiforme is typically found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain regions.
